dialogues.text: Igor has himself frantically pressed against the door, turning to see Victor who’s rushing from machine to machi priming them to overload.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Victor, we-

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: OPEN THIS DOOR, NOW! There’s no way out!

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: The bolt- get the bolt- Igor frantically bolts the door. There’s a crash upstairs the bobbies have breached the flat.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've already sent one of Finnegan's men for a carriage-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Victor, stop, we have to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: And let them have my bloody machines, not likely! We can hear bobbies in the flat upstairs.  85.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get a Lazarus fork. As Igor frantically searches for a fork, Victor turns, pulling up a panel from the floor, revealing a manhole co He begins using a wrench to unscrew the bolts on the cove Upstairs, the bobbies start pounding on the door, hitting with the battering ram. Igor finds a Lazarus Fork.

dialogues.speaker: ALISTAIR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Open the door! Scotland Yard!

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You’re done running, heathens! The road ends here!

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Not enough time- We need a distraction! Turpin has begun booting the alley door; it’s shaking on hinges badly, now. Victor tosses the wrench to Igor, and takes the Lazarus fork from him.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: What’re you-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Get it open! Igor starts working on the manhole cover, while Victor tu and rips open another hidden compartment, some form of refrigerator; there’s a huge burst of cold air... -.-and a corpse falls out of it, into Victor’s arms. Igor stops dead.

dialogues.speaker: KEEP WORKING YOU DAMN FOOL
dialogues.text: Igor keeps working, distracted, panicked. Victor drags th corpse onto the table; it was a young man, but now it’s emaciated and old and MISSING ITS EYES.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Who- ...WHAT-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Igor Hunchback, meet Igor Straussman.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: ++.-you- you-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I found him dead months ago, overdose.  86. Igor stands staring at Victor, pale and shocked. Victor quickly begins locking in the Lazarus Fork. The door upstairs starts to give.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’re you waiting for!? FINISH

dialogues.speaker: MANIAC, WORK DAMN IT
dialogues.text: Victor continues priming Igor Straussman’s corpse for resurrection, and Igor numbly goes back to unscrewing the cover; he’s nearly done.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The brain is undoubtedly too deteriorated- but he still ought to- The door upstairs gives, and Alistair leads the bobbies i charge down the stairs, as Victor FIRES THE DYNAMOS. The overloaded machines spark and LIGHT ON FIRE, filling the basement with fiery chaos- The charge, way too much, BLASTS into Straussman’s corpse resurrecting it and lighting it ablaze. The screaming, flailing, flaming zombie lurches off the table, and Victo casually SHOVES INTO THE ONRUSHING POLICE. Brawling, burning chaos ensues. The door behind Victor is kicked in by Turpin, knocking h down. Turpin bursts in, gun drawn. He takes a shot at Victor, who dives for cover, and then Turpin turns, smack Igor.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: Where’s the hunchback!? Show him to me! Igor staggers back, but finds himself blocked by the anar of Straussman and the bobbies. Turpin grabs him, slamming him against one of the machines.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: No- no- I’m sorry, I’m sorry- Turpin stares at Igor’s face, the realization hitting him

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: My god. It’s you. Victor GRABS TURPIN’S HAND, and SHOVES IT INTO THE SPINNI WHEEL OF ONE OF THE BURNING DYNAMOS. Turpin SCREAMS in ag as his right hand is crushed, which in turn jams the dyna sending a SPRAY OF SPARKS directly into his face. The machine explodes into flame, and Igor goes to try to Turpin as he burns, but Victor grabs him, kicks off the manhole cover, and drags them both down into the sewer ho  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor and Victor fall down into the muck, and Victor yanks Igor to his feet, both of them running, splashing through grime. There’s a splash from behind them, and Igor looks back in the darkness; he can’t see anything. Victor leads Igor through the darkness, finally bursting through a drainage ditch onto

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: They’re a block away from the house, crawling up onto the street. A Finnegan coach, marked as such, is parked nearb

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Come on, come on! Igor falters, pulling away from Victor, but then sees som coming up from the drainage ditch. At this, he jumps onto the alongside Victor, and it speeds off up the street. As the carriage rounds the corner, Turpin, bloodied, burn and shaking, one of his eyes milked over and blinded, pul himself up out of the ditch; he gets a momentary look at carriage, before he falls backwards, into the ditch.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: (barely conscious) F...Finnegan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnegan is at the far end of the luxurious home office, playing darts. He’s focused, intense- Victor bursts in, followed by Igor, who’s clearly still d in thought.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: Frankenstein, Igor, what an unexpected surprise- my god what’re you covered in-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Sewage.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: -delightful-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: The police have raided my home in search of Igor. We managed to evade capture, but in the process we gravely injured several police officers.  88.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: ..-Ah. Why- why exactly did the police- you know on second thought, it doesn’t really matter. I suppose now you’1l have no choice but to leave London, post haste. At the very least, get your sewage covered bodies out of my father’s office.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Yes, very good. Finnegan snaps.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: My family has an estate, the Castle Erskine, in Belgium. Quite rural and secluded, ideally suited to both your needs as a scientist and a, well- fugitive. We could set up a new lab, with help from Dettweiler, and-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Yes yes, good, we’ll leave immediately.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: Oh will you? Ha, right, I’1ll go prepare a coach. Finnegan heads out of the room. Victor sighs.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: This is your fault, I hope you know that. Parading about town with the acrobat. Still, all is forgiven; perhaps this change of scenery will-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: I’m not going ANYWHERE with you.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: What? For the first time in our story, Igor is visibly ANGRY.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: You amoral psychotic piece of shit- Scratch that, FURIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Igor-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: How could you do that? To keep from me for months that you had killed a man and given me his name-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn’t kill him- you’re overreacting!

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: No, Victor, enough is enough-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: You have a chance here to be part of-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Of what? Being lied to, chased by monsters and hunted by police-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Oh, don’t focus on the dark side-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: NO! You’re- you’re a- a BAD FRIEND. Victor is startled by the simpleness of the accusation, a Maybe even hurt.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: After all I did for you-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: You care for no one but Victor Frankenstein-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I told you I didn’t kill Straussman-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: And why should I believe you!? In my time with you I’ve seen you put lives in danger in pursuit of your dreams, your experiments-—

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Straussman was a waste of space, this fanfare from you is more of a funeral than his own family would've given him-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: So he deserved to be toyed with like a puppet to help you escape, to have his eyes torn out of his head, where was HIS second chance-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I hadn't invented the fork yet, I couldn’t- Why are you saying these things, can’t you see- Finnegan reenters.  90.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: All right, time is of the essence. Gentlemen, your coach is ready-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: No Victor I see clearly. You are blind, and you have no capacity to see what’s happened, what you’ve done-

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: -also, if I could ask you to turn down the volume, my parents are home after all- Victor looks from Finnegan, to Igor and back.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: You can go to your ruin. But I’m staying here.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Oh? And going where, exactly? Back to the Blue Meringue to resume your illustrious-—

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: It’s none of your concern.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: None of my- Oh, just brilliant! What? To Lorelei? Where will you go? Igor is silent, staring at Victor; Victor can feel himsel being judged, slowly realizing that Igor is completely ou his control. His expression changes.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You fool. I created you. Clown! Circus freak! You think because I put you in a back-brace and cut your hair you can turn your back on me, go ahead, see how far you get in the real world with your “acrobat” and your new life! You stand in the way of the future, you're an embarrassment to everything I’d hoped to accomplish! Fine! Fine! I’m rid of you, rid of you, rid of you! Victor stands there, breathing hard, waiting for Igor to respond. He doesn’t. Victor fidgets, seeming about to spe again, then turns and storms out. Igor looks after him in shocked disappointment. MOMENTS LATER...  91. Igor stands on the balcony, watching Victor below as he g into a coach, stolid, emotionless. Finnegan appears next him, and looks down at the departing coach, then at Igor. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: So what’s next for you, then?

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: ...I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: That’s sad to hear, old boy. Sad to hear. Seems you and Victor have had a bit of a falling out.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: I said what I meant to say.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: Very well, very well, good for you. (beat) You know, I knew Igor Straussman. Igor blinks. FINNEGAN (CONT’D) A real bore, nouveau riche, drug addict. Nothing like...this.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: Ah-ah-ah. So who are you then? That’s the question. Doesn’t matter, really. Victor’s been very forthcoming with his designs, but I still need him for now. You, on the other hand-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Finnegan-

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: So let’s see: your benefactor has departed, your home has been ransacked by police, your identity revealed as a fraud...Do you understand what I’m saying? (beat) What I’m getting at, old sport, is that you won’t be missed. Igor is jabbed in the neck with a syringe, and one of Finnegan’s goons YANKS A BURLAP SACK OVER IGOR’S HEAD FRO BEHIND. SMASH TO BLACK.  92. We can hear the sounds of a carriage rattling up the stre we're in Igor’s POV. Finnegan speaks; Igor’s drugged, and through the burlap sack Finnegan’s face distorts in nightmarish ways. FINNEGAN (0.C) (CONT’D) You know you and Victor aren’t the only ones with vision. You aren’t the only ones trying to change the world. I too have a dream of the future. A dream where the British empire extends not just to India and Africa, but over the entire globe. A world where dead enemy soldiers are reassembled into new British troops. I see an unkillable army of your monsters, one million strong, marching across Paris, Moscow, Washington DC... (beat) Oh, you don’t approve. I’d imagined you and Victor wouldn’t like that much. Luckily, the architects won’t have to live in the house they built. Goodbye “Igor.” There’s the sound of a door opening.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: A watery impact - SPLASH! Igor, the bag over his head, his ankles bound together an his hands tied behind his back, rapidly sinks down into t water. He struggles frantically, but can’t get free. Igor’s nearly at the bottom now; it’s getting dark. He manages to shake off the bag, but still can’t get his han free of the binds. He’s running out of air; he stares up at the light coming down through the water high above him. He’s out of time. Igor bends violently forward, cracking his back! He SCREA in pain, but the new position allows him to slip his hand under his feet, which lets him rip off the bindings aroun his ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor, returned to his hunchbacked state, drags himself up through the mud onto the shore of the Thames. He vomits o water, coughing, and howls in pain, tearing off his wrist bindings and clutching his back. He looks up noticing a group of little boys who were play by the river.  93.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Help...Help me- The little boys, horrified of this muddy river monster, t and run. Igor lays there, sobbing and coughing. EXT. BARON BOMINE’S RESIDENCE - LATER Lorelei is sitting at a tea table in the gardens, sipping and reading a book. There’s a crash from nearby, and Lore stands up, going around the side of the house, where she sees... Igor, filthy and pathetic, the hunchback, cowering behind some garbage bins. He stares up at her, helpless and ashamed. She goes to him. FADE TO BLACK. FADE IN... It's been at least a week. Igor, worn out, is in a bed, sick....He tries to get up, but then collapses onto the ground; Lorelei rushes to help him.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Victor...Victor... Igor passes out. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: ABRUPT CUT TO
dialogues.text: A crucifix, dangling limply. There’s a scratching sound i the background. INT. SCOTLAND YARD - CHIEF INSPECTOR’S OFFICE Roderick Turpin sits alone in the police chief's officer the desk. He’s grinding the heavy brass hook that used to his right hand back and forth on the arm of his chair. Time has past, and his injuries are healing: his left eye gone, covered by a leather patch. His skin is pock-marked with electrical burns, still covered by bandages. He is staring straight ahead at the chief's empty seat. H doesn’t move at all, except for the grinding hook. The CHIEF INSPECTOR enters, flanked by Alistair, who goes stands by Turpin. The Chief sits. He and Turpin stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: Straussman wasn’t Straussman.  94.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Beg pardon?

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: The body, the burning creature, that was Straussman. The young man who said he was Straussman was in fact the hunchback, transformed by Frankenstein-

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Inspector, this is not-

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: They escaped by way of a Finnegan Family Coach; Finnegan also attends Royal College of Medicine, makes sense, he’s in on it too, maybe funding them-

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Inspector Turpin, stop-

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: I would guess that Frankenstein has fled the country, more than likely alongside Finnegan, who a little digging showed spends his summers at Castle Erskine in Belgium-

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Roderick-

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: Which is where we’ll find them, the Hunchback on the other hand- well you see we never found the girl, the aerialist, and I’d wager-

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: Listen. We can catch them-

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: We can. And we will.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: ...-Am I to understand-

dialogues.speaker: ALISTAIR
dialogues.text: You're being removed from the case.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: The whole force, in fact. Constable Alistair will be taking your place. You are on a medical and mental reprieve.  95.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: Don’t do this. Please.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Belgium, Roderick? High society hunchbacks, undead monsters, conspiracies involving one of the richest families in England? You've lost your grip, Roddy, you've lost your whole hand! Your eye! Take a break, please!

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: I’m doing this for you. Spend some time with you daughter, rest, good god man. You are the best detective we have, and you haven’t- you haven't slowed down since Claudia died-

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: Don’t you mention her name. Don’t you ever say her name. Turpin seems to think for a moment, then picks up his cha and hurls it into the wall, shattering it. He stands ther uncomfortable, and then looks to Alistair.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Justice will be done. Alistair just looks a afraid. Turpin calmly walks out, slamming the door behind him. INT. BARON BOMINE’S RESIDENCE - BATHROOM Igor is on the floor, braced against the side of the bath and the edge of the sink. He twists his body; there are terrible cracking and popping sounds, and he gasps in pai then WRENCHES HIMSELF TO THE LEFT- CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: SWISH TO
dialogues.text: Igor clicking the backbrace back on. He looks out the window, determined. EXT. BARON BOMINE’S RESIDENCE - NIGHT Igor exits the house, heading down the steps, walking wit purpose. Moments afterwards, Lorelei bursts out.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Go back to sleep-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor, don’t do this, don’t go-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Lorelei.

dialogues.speaker: LORELEI
dialogues.text: You can stay here, with me, and forget all this-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: I cannot forget.

dialogues.speaker: LORELEI
dialogues.text: This is a man who has already attempted to murder you once and very nearly succeeded, please- Igor you’ve never even left London, it isn’t- 96. Igor stops, turning, yelling in anger for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: I must! Don’t you see that? I cannot let Victor die, and I cannot see this horror created in his name, it’s- this is my responsibility. I have to go, Lorelei, I have to stop it. He stands there, breathing hard, more human than we’ve ev seen him, and touches his back in pain. Lorelei, seeing h as though for the first time, pauses, thinking, and then.

dialogues.speaker: LORELEI
dialogues.text: Igor...You once told me of a world you and Victor wanted to create. A world filled with hope instead of fear. It is a beautiful, beautiful dream. (beat) Don’t let them turn it into a nightmare. Igor nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out on the docks on the English Channel, Igor ticket information for his passport. He gets board a tramp steamer, giving the ticket to a He gets halfway up the ramp before the sailor

dialogues.speaker: SAILOR
dialogues.text: Oi! We need a first AND last name. is filling in up and goes to SAILOR. shouts at him. Igor takes the paper back, staring at it. IGOR...  97. He takes the pencil, and fills in SURNAME: FRANKENSTEIN.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM TO
dialogues.text: Igor stands out on the deck of the ship as it sails acros the choppy Atlantic Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: WE SEE
dialogues.text: Brief shots of Igor travelling. We know where we’re going and why, and we don’t know what we’ll find there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A carriage for hire rattles up the road towards a little picturesque village set at the base of rolling hills. Halfway up one of the hills sits a very tall windmill, attached to an old farmhouse. And at the top of that same hill, surrounded by thick woo is Castle Erksine...An ancient stone castle, gray against dimming sky, surrounded by a dry moat. A storm is brewing on the horizon, lightning crackling in black clouds. Rain has started to trickle down. Igor leans out, staring at the castle.

dialogues.speaker: WE SEE
dialogues.text: Igor arriving at the town’s tavern. The coach rattles off leaving him alone. The street seems oddly empty. INT. ERSKINE TAVERN — ALMOST CONTINUOUS Igor comes in, shaking off the rain. He heads quickly to bar, where he greets a pleasant BELGIAN BAR MAID.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Good evening. Listen, I’m just here on business. I was wondering if you wouldn’t mind giving me some directions up to the castle- The door bursts open, and a BELGIAN COUNCILMAN along with TOWN HEAVY.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY
dialogues.text: -this is the will of god- you’ve seen what they do up there, you’ve seen the robbed graves- Inspector, tell him- Turpin (!!!) enters, soaking wet from the rain; Igor flin himself around behind the bar. He crouches there, panicke  98.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: What you are dealing with here is criminals, councilman, you must remember that: Every second you allow them to continue their business up their you are effectively harboring them. This cannot stand. Igor looks up at the bar-maid; he gives her a winning smi and the “sssshhhh” gesture. She giggles and nods. He star crawling towards a back-door.

dialogues.speaker: COUNCILMAN
dialogues.text: But surely, not tonight- the storm, the rain-

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: You think that’s a bloody coincidence!? They're causing the goddamn storm- you said you saw all the electrical equipment brought in, all the animal corpses too, it’s- they use technology, yeah? The recent storms and flooding have been a product of their folly, they’re to blame for the bad crop.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY
dialogues.text: I’ve talked to the whole town about it, thirty strong men ready to go up there and get those Irish bastards out of here- Igor makes it to the back-door.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: Don't be a coward, councilman. We must take things into our own hands, don’t you see that? The rumors around your town; grave- robbing, black magic, witchcraft, I am here from Scotland Yard, confirming them. These men are in allegiance with Satan, and must be stopped. They- Igor slips out silently, but Turpin still turns instantly

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...must be stopped.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM TO
dialogues.text: Igor, running frantically up hill, through the woods, breathing hard, totally freaking out. The rain has really started pouring down, the wind gettin stronger, and the darkness of night settling in.  99. Igor’s fancy clothes are torn and dirtied, but he doesn’t stop running until- suddenly- pain. The exertion is straining his back; it’s healed, but still weak. He trips and falls, holding his back, onto a rocky ledge. Down below he can see people coming into town from the harvest riding a plow, holding pitchforks, lighting their by torchlight. They're mobilizing. Lightning flashes in the clouds. The rain pours down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor, exhausted, his back aching, makes it to the bridge the dried out moat. He stumbles and nearly falls, out of breath, filthy and soaking wet. He creeps around the side of the castle, looking for a wa in. Finally, he comes to the base of huge, gnarly, overgr tree. Igor climbs up and through the branches, finally at the t he’s able to plan a jump across to the castle’s top wall walkway. One of Finnegan’s guards walks past, and Igor nearly fall out of the tree in his effort to conceal himself. The gua passes, and Igor pulls himself up and flings himself acro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor sneaks along the upper wall, finally coming to a bre in the wall where he can see down into the courtyard, whe Victor's laboratory is set up. It is INCREDIBLE. Giant-size versions of all his laboratory machinery have set up, abuzz with power, and a huge scaffolding system h been set up around a raised platform next to one of the towers; the scaffolding goes up fifty feet into the air, atop it sits Victor’s hypothetical lightning magnet, the CLOUD HOOK. On the platform stands Victor and Dettweiler; Victor wear completely awesome looking buttoned up labcoat, with huge gnarly looking goggles on his forehead. Dettweiler wears black version of much the same. Between them is a massive gurney, but Igor can’t get a go look at what’s on it... To Igor, who saw all this when it was just a pipe-dream, breathtaking. There are several other scientists/technici in lab-wear working the machines, supervised by Finnegan, looks excited.  100. He stealthily moves to the lower level, and quietly sneak through the lab, moving towards Victor and Dettweiler on platform. And as the gurney tilts up, there it is: The PROMETHEUS is just over ten feet tall, stitched toget for over two dozen different donors. Its body is gargantu and misshapen; its head is oddly shaped, the face wide an bizarre, a mess of features stretched and jigsawed togeth to create a simulation of humanity. Igor watches as Victor goes under one of the big machines into the inner-workings.

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE...
dialogues.text: Victor, goggles down, is fiddling with dials and wires; t machinery around him has begun to spark and glow with ene It’s powering up.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Victor. Victor turns wto see Igor, having snuck in from the other side, lit by the flashes of electricity give the cramped space an ethereal light. He doesn’t seem to have any kind reaction.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: How-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: You have to stop the experiment.

dialogues.speaker: DETTWEILER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Almost done down there?

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: You came all this way-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Turpin’s in the town.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: He’s in the town, he’s coming here-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: But that’s absurd, he has no jurisdiction-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: I really don’t think that matters to him anymore.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: -.-You’re lying, you’re just trying to drag me down again, did my father send you-  101.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: It’s a soldier, Victor. Victor stops dead.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s used you.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: You've created the prototype for a weapon, Victor, a living weapon-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Absurd- I won’t- I don’t believe it-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Have you known me to lie? Once? Ever? The machine sparks, and Victor flinches.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Finnegan tried to have me killed, Victor. I’ve come here to save you, as I believe he intends to kill you too when you’ve outlived your usefulness and given him what he wants. We can still get out of this, Victor, but you must stop the experiment.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Victor, what on earth are you doing down there- Victor stares at Igor. Finnegan peers down at them, then jerks back. FINNEGAN (CONT’D) Guards! Guards! Intruder! Igor darts out

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE
dialogues.text: And makes mad dash across the laboratory, but he’s tackle and dragged down by two of Finnegan's goons.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: No- Victor, help me! Victor, coming out from under the machine, seems a millio miles away; his expression is unreadable.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: Breaking and entering, really? High drama! Intrigue! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take him away, we'll deal with him after the exp-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Don’t do this, Victor, don’t let it happen- One of the guards punches Igor in the face, shutting him Victor flinches.

dialogues.speaker: DETTWEILER
dialogues.text: The machines are ready. Mr. Frankenstein, if you please. Victor takes one last look at Igor, then steps up onto th platform. Finnegan hops on alongside him, and nods to a l tech nearby, who throws a massive switch; with a great creaking, and rattling roar, the platform begins to rise through the gantries, towards the swirling storm high abo

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: Don’t let that parasite distract you, Victor. He’s just trying to steal your moment. He had his chance to be a part of this, and he gave it up. Victor's silent, watching Igor scream up to him, muted by roar of the machines.

dialogues.speaker: DETTWEILER
dialogues.text: Everything is running at one hundred percent efficiency. Your designs are flawless. Priming the Cloud Hook now. Dettweiler flips a switch, and above them, at the top of elevator machinery, the “Cloud Hook” glows to life with a rumble; they’re easily thirty feet in the air now. Victor looks over his Prometheus, massive and menacing.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Is it a soldier? Finnegan falters, looking to Dettweiler, who's as expressionless as ever.

dialogues.speaker: COURTYARD
dialogues.text: Igor’s being dragged inside by the two heavies.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: No, this isn’t- this isn’t- OUTSIDE...  103. Turpin and his mob of villages have arrived, in a fervor. They’re using the plow to ram the main gate, again and ag

dialogues.speaker: ...- INSIDE
dialogues.text: The thugs are momentarily distracted by the sound at the front gates. Igor wrenches his body, snapping the back-brace shut on o of his captor’s hands. The man screams in agony, and Igor kick’s out the other man’s knee, effortlessly circus roll out of his grasp. He takes off running, shoving past the lab technicians an jumping over equipment before jumping up onto the bottom the scaffolding, rapidly climbing up towards the still ascending platform.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Is it a soldier? Answer me.

dialogues.speaker: DETTWEILER
dialogues.text: Yes. It is.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: Dettweiler, really-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: My...my central pursuit has been the preservation of life, and you’ve- you've deceived me into building a killing machine. The platform grinds to a halt, now suspended fifty feet u atop the gantry way, the Cloud Hook crackling with energy next to them. Down below, the machinery’s grinding causes Igor to slip, nearly plummeting off the scaffolding.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: Deceived you, really? Is that what I did? Did you ever even think to ask? Of course not, because for all your genius, all your inventions, you’re still a small mind, Frankenstein. You deserve to be used, you require it, because you can only see the little picture, sight, but no vision! (straightens himself) Victor, now isn’t the time nor the place for a philosophical debate. Activate the Cloud Hook. Victor just stares at him.  104.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for, activate the-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: You tried to kill Igor.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: I- damn it- Do it now, Frankenstein-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I've perverted everything I hoped to achieve. I’ma fool.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: Activate the hook, you’ve got no choice-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I beg to differ. Victor begins violently yanking electrodes and wires out the Prometheus, ignoring Finnegan.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: What’re- No, damn it, Dettweiler, stop him! Dettweiler draws a pistol. Victor stops, staring at it.

dialogues.speaker: DETTWEILER
dialogues.text: I have wanted to tell you, Victor: You are a child. You know nothing of the world. Now stop this foolish tantrum or I will take action to ensure that this experiment is a a success. Victor stares at him for a moment, chuckles, and goes rig back to yanking out the electrodes. Dettweiler raises the gun.

dialogues.speaker: DETTWEILER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pathetic. I told you, I never work with a partner. Victor's eyes flit to the right of Dettweiler and then ba

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Funny. I do. Dettweiler is GRABBED FROM BEHIND BY IGOR, PULLING HIMSEL OVER THE RAILING. Dettweiler’s shot goes wild, hitting th Cloud Hook. It sparks, insanely bright for a moment, and Dettweiler shoves Igor backwards, nearly off the edge, raising his g  105. The Cloud-Hook EXPLODES TO LIFE, DOZENS OF LIGHTNING BOLT

dialogues.speaker: BARRAGE OF LIGHT HEAT AND SOUND.
dialogues.text: The damaged Cloud Hook comes off its hinges, smashing Dettweiler off the platform; he plummets down into an electrical console, BAM! Dead. The Hook’s restraints snap, and it swings free, now SPRAY

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTNING INTO THE LAB, AN INDOOR ELECTRICAL STORM OF
dialogues.text: INCREDIBLE INTENSITY, frying Finnegan’s goons and scienti overloading the machines and causing them to burst into b flame!

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Unexpected-

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: No! No! NO! What’ve you done, you idiots- The entire platform framework, blasted by the lightning, destabilizes, blowing apart, causing the platform to drop herky-jerky down through the center of the structure, Igo Victor and Finnegan struggling to hold on. The Cloud Hook, overcharged with energy, EXPLODES!

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Victor! THE PLATFORM FLIPS as it completely comes free of the elevator machinery, and Igor goes crashing to the- SLAM TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: The air is choked with smoke. Fires burn all around, contained but unbearably hot. Igor lays face down on the ground, half conscious. The plow again crashes into the gate; it’s splintering no starting to crack. Soon, they'll be inside.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (somewhere in the smoke) Igor! Is that you down there? Igor blinks, confused, and then there’s a gunshot! Finnegan's trying to freaking shoot him! Igor hurries away, moving blindly through the smoke; he c hear but not see Finnegan. He trips for a moment over something; it’s the gurney.  106. It’s empty. Igor can hear the breathing behind him. He turns, slowly. And there it is... The Prometheus towers over him, staring down at Igor with face that conveys absolutely no emotion, a completely vac blank slate. There’s another crash! at the front gate. The monster glances at the gate, then back at Igor.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: All right...easy...easy... Another crash at the gates. The Prometheus’s face remains entirely blank.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just- The Prometheus grunts, and then SWATS IGOR INTO THE AIR; bounces hard off some equipment, damaging it, and lands o the ground bent double in pain; he tries to stand, but fi he can’t... .--The damn back-brace is broken, trapping him into his o hunchbacked position. He can barely move, much less stand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The villagers are about to drive the plow into the door a when THE PROMETHEUS CRASHES THROUGH THE CASTLE GATES FROM INSIDE! It FLIPS THE PLOW onto the villagers, and begins TEARING its way through them, punching, swatting and smas its way across the bridge. Turpin is knocked down, and stares in horror at the monst

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: A...A demon, a demon from Hell... The Prometheus continues brawling through the townspeople but Turpin stands, staggering inside: bigger fish to fry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turpin stumbles in, still looking over his shoulder, and turns to see the lab. The smoke is thick in the courtyard now; you can barely see in some areas. Finnegan prowls through the smoke, gun drawn, twitchy. Igor, on nearly the other side of the courtyard, struggle with his back-brace, seeing Finnegan searching for him. H crawls, desperate.  107. Turpin moves amongst the anarchy, in awe of all the burni sparking, exploding equipment. He sees Igor crawling, and moves towards him like a bullet.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Inspector Turpin- please listen- you don’t know, you don’t know what’s happened here, you’re not- Turpin isn’t hearing it; he grabs Igor, yanking him up; I can barely move. Turpin’s got a look of insane exhilarati on his face; this is it, the moment he’s waited for!

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: I’ve got you. I’ve finally got you.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Please- you’re in danger- Finnegan, up on a bank of equipment, sees movement throug the smoke, raises his gun and fires. Turpin blinks, releasing Igor.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: I- I don’t- He collapses forward, Igor catching him as they fall to t ground. Igor rips open Turpin’s shirt, trying to put pressure on the bloody gunshot wound in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: No- no no- Turpin, in shock, coughing up blood, looks up at Igor, watching as Igor tears off his own sleeve, trying to stop bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: Why’re you- trying to save me?

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: I’m a doctor. It’s what I do. Turpin, through the shock, is looking around at all the technology; he didn’t understand, he knows that now. By g he thought he knew, but he had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: I-...I’ve made a terrible mistake. As Igor works frantically, Turpin’s clouded eyes drift up the lightning storm raging in the clouds above him; brigh and celestial. It all hits him at once, sanity flooding b in.  108.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My daughter...What have I done, who will take care of my daughter- I left her with my sister, she can’t support- she can’t- my daughter, who will... Igor, horrified, watches as the light fades from Turpin’s eyes, and the body goes limp in his arms. OUTSIDE... The Prometheus’ rampage continues. INSIDE...

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: Who the bloody hell is that? Finnegan is climbing down one of the fallen tesla coils, in hand. Igor looks up, covered in Turpin’s blood and his own, shaking. FINNEGAN (CONT’D) Ha. Ahaha. Look at this mess, look at this mess you’ve made. Finnegan's upper-class demeanor is cracking as he approac Igor, reloading his gun. The fall from the platform tore clothes and mussed his hair; he looks dangerous, sharklik Igor gently sets down Turpin, trying to force himself to feet, find some way to defend himself, but the back-brace makes it impossible. OUTSIDE... Outside, the monster begins to violently retreat down the hill, the remaining mob giving chase. INSIDE... Finnegan finishes reloading his gun, and seems to think; looking at all the destruction has “flustered” him. FINNEGAN (CONT’D) Why is this good? Is this what you wanted? To stand in the way of the science? Who gave you the right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor, trembling, stares at Finnegan; there’s a tremendous hate in his eyes, and Finnegan, feeling it, steps back, intimidated despite his position of total control.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: You're a monster.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: No. No I’m not. I think you’1l find I’m quite human.  109. Finnegan raises his gun. Igor just stares at him evenly, unafraid. Finnegan steadies his aim.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Finnegan! Finnegan looks up slowly, turning to see VICTOR FRANKENST hunched in pain, his hair wild, covered in ash and more t a little burnt, but still very much alive. He holds two e of a huge severed electrical cord.

dialogues.speaker: FINNEGAN
dialogues.text: Victor! You’re...alive, fascinating-—

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: You wanted me to create death. Finnegan laughs, and then realizes the cord Victor holds down into the base of the massive collapsed tesla coil directly to his left. Finnegan tries to raise his gun- but Victor joins the sev cord- A BLAST OF ELECTRICITY BLOWS FINNEGAN ACROSS THE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There. I’ve created death. Victor tosses down the cord in disgust. Igor struggles a moment, falling. He lays there next to Turpin’s corpse, listening to the sounds of battle fade outside, collectin himself, and then pushes as hard as he can- -and breaks free of the back-brace. He stares at it layin twisted on the floor and shoves himself to his feet, wipi the blood off his face: he is MESSED UP. He looks around, and sees Victor futilely trying to put o the fires on the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: You saved my life again.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Help me put out these damn fires-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: The fires? But Victor-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: With Finnegan dead we'll never get this quality of equipment again! Electron coils, particle transducers—

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Victor-  110.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Help me, damn it, it’ll-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: NO VICTOR. You're going to come with me, and you're going to help me kill the Prometheus-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Kill it!? Why on earth- It comes out of Igor with the force of a hurricane:

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Damn it, enough! Enough! I’ve seen you do wondrous things Victor, some terrible but wondrous things. You’re the greatest mind of your generation, but your blindness has already cost too much! (summons up courage) I’ve seen the way your father treats you! This will never be good enough for him! Nothing you ever do will be good enough for him, you could resurrect all of England and he would scoff and call you a disappointment! You can’t bring your brother back! At this, Victor stops trying to put out the fires. He sta into the flames; the lab continues to explode around them but he’s motionless.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were the one who gave me the strength I needed to become the man I wanted to be. Now trust me, please. Stop pretending not to care about anyone or anything, and Victor, damn it, grow up and help me stop this thing before it hurts anyone else. BE A MAN AND TAKE

dialogues.speaker: RESPONSIBILITY FOR YOUR CREATION
dialogues.text: Electricity crackles. The fires burn. In the distance we can hear pandemonium; yelling and screaming, people afrai Victor turns to Igor, very quickly wiping away tears.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I don’t suppose you have...a very, very large shovel? Igor smiles.  111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and Igor, bruised, battered and bloody, approach t massive Dutch Windmill on the side of the hill; the villa are gathered around it. At first it appears they have the Prometheus trapped in t house portion, but then the Prometheus tromps out and tak few people down, before going back in.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Victor and Igor try to get through the crowd, and can’t; Victor draws and fires Finnegan’s gun. The crowd parts like the red sea, and Igor and Victor mov through, with the gun still raised.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Please remain calm. We are unlicensed medical professionals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor kicks in the door; Igor comes in through a massive hole in the wall next to the door. They exchange a look. The farmhouse is sparse, and the inside is completely destroyed, broken furniture everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL, (DUTCH)
dialogues.text: Help me, please help me. Victor and Igor turn to see an adorable blonde girl stand nearby, petrified in fear.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: It's alright, we’re here to- The MONSTER SMASHES OUT OF A ROOM TO THEIR RIGHT, FLOORIN IGOR. Victor opens fire wildly as the creature crosses th room; he mostly misses, and the bullets that do hit have almost no effect. The creature grabs the girl in one of its massive hands, roars at Victor and crashes through a wall into the insid the windmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior of the windmill stretches out above them, th inside lit by torches. There are a series of flimsy woode platforms built around the central windmill machinery, connected by diagonal ladders, leading up to the top. The monster stands at the bottom, above a big well full o water, dunking the terrified little girl.  112. Victor hurriedly picks up one of the long, sharp steel po they use as bolts on the well, as Igor strafes around the monster.

dialogues.speaker: HEY. WANKER.
dialogues.text: The monster takes notice of Victor.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m your creator. I’m the one that brought you back to life, do you understand? The monster stares at him, that blank face again...THEN R and flings one of the torches on the wall. Victor dodges, and the torch hits a table full of unlit lanterns WHICH EXPLODE INTO FLAME.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bloody hell- The Prometheus charges, still holding the girl, and Victo forced into a frantic, pulse pounding chase up the interi of the windmill, complicated in four ways: NUMBER 1: The monster’s weight is too much for the ladder and the platforms, which crumple mere moments after it cl onto them. NUMBER 2: The monster, still clutching the little girl, i swinging WILDLY at Victor, repeatedly smashing the windmi machinery, thusly destabilizing the entire structure. NUMBER 3: The fire started at the base is rapidly spreadi up the old, papery structure, engulfing everything, and starting to fill the interior with thick black smoke. NUMBER 4: Igor is in hot pursuit, but he’s being forced t run, jump and climb up the platforms AS THEY COLLAPSE. Victor, reaching the uppermost platform, abruptly turns, ducking around the central windmill milling-engine. This outsmarts and surprises the Prometheus, and Victor DRIVES STEEL ROD THROUGH ITS HEART. The Prometheus falters, teetering over what’s now a strai drop nearly sixty feet down. It looks down at the rod sticking out of its chest, and DROPS THE LITTLE GIRL- Victor dives and catches her hand, swinging her to Igor o the collapsing platform below them. Igor catches the girl and rolls, putting her out through the one window, onto t passing fan of the windmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl is safely carried down to the ground, and then t WINDMILL’S FAN CRACKS AND FALLS, BURNING, SCATTERING THE

dialogues.speaker: LEVEL...
dialogues.text: The monster seems ready to topple into the abyss, when suddenly it YANKS THE STEEL ROD OUT OF ITS CHEST AND FLIN If AT VICTOR. It impales him through the shoulder and sen him flying backwards, embedding in the wall, pinning Vict there like a bug. Igor screams; his best friend is mortally wounded. He pul himself up onto the last platform as the one beneath it collapses. The Prometheus takes a few huge swings at him, but Igor ducks and rolls, clown-style, The final, top platform begins to fracture and come apart they’1l all be plunged into the fire- Igor, thinking quickly, grabs a handful of burning embers from the edge of the platform and flings them into the monster’s face; blinded it turns, and Igor pushes up, off wall, kick himself forward and- THROWS HIS WEIGHT ON THE MONSTER’S BACK, CAUSING IT TO FA

dialogues.speaker: SECOND HEART.
dialogues.text: The Prometheus gives one last tremendous scream of rage, right into Victor’s face...and dies. Its slumping dead weight further buckles the platform.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean it-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: (frantic) Those things I said back in England, you have to know I didn’t mean any of it. I was just upset, I respect you- more than any other person, you must know- Igor I’m so sorry- Igor goes and tries to wrench the pole out of the wall. I no good; it’s in there deep. Victor screams in pain.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have to get out of here, you have to go-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: I’m not going to leave you here-  114. Igor begins pushing on the monster; it sloooowly slides u the shiskabob, far too slowly with the windmill collapsin this rate. Victor grabs Igor with his good arm.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Igor this is what I’ve earned. I did this to myself. Igor stares at him: maybe he’s right? The windmill contin to collapse.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The well, Igor. If you jump you can make it, I know you can- Igor looks down at the well, far below them. Maybe he cou He readies himself, measuring the distance.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gasping his words through agony ) Listen, Igor, listen to me. I didn’t kill Straussman. I found him in the living room, I thought he was asleep but then I saw the needle...and then the pragmatist in me just took over, as he always does, and he wasn’t a man anymore just pieces, just new equipment. I swear to you though I didn’t ki-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Good, now I can- I can stay here- Igor, you must go, it’s-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Oh, you’ve sealed my fate. There’s no way I’m going to leave you now.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: What? Why!?

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Because you didn’t kill Igor Straussman. Igor throws all his weight into one more push, and, miraculously, the Prometheus drops, falling through the center level of the windmill, plummeting down into the fi Igor glances down again at the well, now also surrounded fire and jagged rubble.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give me your hand. Victor nods, and takes Igor’s hand; Igor begins to agonizingly pull him up the steel rod-  115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The top level of the windmill drops in, collapsing, and t with a series of ember filled explosions, the rest of the windmill collapsing down with it in a huge heap of wrecka The villagers step back, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rubble of the windmill burns. FADE TO BLACK. HOLD ON BLACK. Zzt. Zzzt. Electrical crackling. Little spots of light filling the screen and then ZAP

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: Turpin sits up, gasping in air, the Lazarus fork on his n sparking wildly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is rising over a mountain range. The little cotta has clearly been abandoned for some time; Castle Erskine in the distance, still leaking smoke up into the brighten sky. From here we have a beautiful view of a rustic lake. Turpin, his chest bandaged, sits staring out over the wat at the sunset; he’s clearly deep in thought. Igor slowly approaches him. Turpin speaks without looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN
dialogues.text: My entire life I have strived in the pursuit of my beliefs. Beliefs in God, in the law...in a world with rules, rules to preserve what matters in a world filled with anarchy, greed, and evil. I suppose I needed them, the rules. Needed them so much I let them control my choices, my decisions, I... Turpin glances at Igor.

dialogues.speaker: TURPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know you, hunchback. Don’t know Victor. Maybe I thought I did... (beat) In those last moments, I wasn’t thinking about the law, or right and wrong, or even...even God. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TURPIN (CONT’D) All I wanted, all that mattered, is that I would see my daughter again. And you've given me that. (beat) I don’t imagine that I have much credence left at the yard, but...Should you return to England, I can see to it you won’t be troubled any further. Igor gives it a beat, and then smiles. The two of them si staring out at the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor, heavily bandaged and clearly a bit weary from his wounds and considerably rough night, is readying two hors packing his remaining equipment into the saddlebags. Igor stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Well, brilliant, good for him, but we're certainly not going back to England.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: ...we’re not?

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: No, I’m through with Great Britain; nothing left for me there. I think perhaps you're quite right about my father, for now, and I’ve been expelled from school, hunted by the law, and betrayed by a power-hungry nobleman, thoroughly electrocuted and finally impaled by a monster of my own idiotic creation and nearly burnt to death in a Belgian windmill. (laughs) I think it’s time I started fresh, yes?

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: But Victor-

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: America! Now there’s a place that isn’t afraid of progress; I'm confident we’ll be able to flourish and thrive out in the colonies. You and I, back to working together with no interlopers, I now having a much better understanding of the technology as well as the proper way to treat my fellow man-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Victor, I...  117.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Yes? Igor fidgets, nervous, unsure how to say what’s in his he Victor waits, looking oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: I can’t go with you. (quickly) I would, I- I can’t. Lorelei is waiting for me back in London. I love her, Victor, and there are- opportunities for me- I can have a life of my own, Victor. A real life. Victor stares at him. Igor drops his eyes, terrified; he knows what's coming.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Well...then. I suppose that’s perfectly reasonable.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: ...what?

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: (haltingly) You have made incredible sacrifices in the purpose of our cause, shown shocking amounts of tenacity, bravery and loyalty to me as a friend and collaborator, it would be wrong of me to ask you to give up the opportunity to be with the woman you love and-

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Victor! Igor rushes to and embraces Victor, who grunts in pain an generally looks uncomfortable. Igor holds on anyway, cryi overcome with joy.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are a good man, Victor Frankenstein. I knew you were a good man. At this, Victor allows himself a small, warm smile, unsee Igor. LATER... Turpin is readying a horse, whilst Victor is astride one, trotting away down the road from Igor.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR, (CONT'D)
